action.action-desc: Mr. Reed (for himself, Mr. Pascrell, Mr. Nunes, and Mr. Larson of Connecticut) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the depreciation recovery period for energy-efficient cool roof systems.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Roofing Efficiency Jobs Act of 2014
.

section.header: Depreciation recovery period for certain roof systems

paragraph.text: Subparagraph (F) of section 168(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to classification of certain property) is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: initial clearing and grading land improvements with respect to any electric utility transmission and distribution plant, and
any qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property.

paragraph.header: Qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property
paragraph.text: Section 168(e) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property

subparagraph.text: The term qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property means any roof system—

subclause.text: above conditioned or semiheated space on an eligible commercial building, and
after the date of the enactment of this paragraph,

clause.text: which replaces an existing roof system,
which is a low-slope roof (a slope equal to or less then 2:12),

subclause.text: insulation which meets or exceeds the minimum prescriptive requirements in tables A–1 to A–9 in the Normative Appendix A of ASHRAE Standard 189.1–2011, and

in the case of an eligible commercial building located in a climate zone other than climate zone 6, 7, or 8 (as specified in ASHRAE Standard 189.1–2011), a primary roof covering which has a cool roof surface.

subparagraph.text: The term cool roof surface means a roof the exterior surface of which—

clause.text: has a 3-year-aged solar reflectance of at least 0.55 and a 3-year-aged thermal emittance of at least 0.75, as determined in accordance with the Cool Roof Rating Council CRRC–1 Product Rating Program, or
has a 3-year-aged solar reflectance index (SRI) of at least 64, as determined in accordance with ASTM Standard E1980, determined—

subclause.text: using a medium-wind-speed convection coefficient of 12 W/m2·K, and
using the values for 3-year-aged solar reflectance and 3-year-aged thermal emittance determined in accordance with the Cool Roof Rating Council CRRC–1 Product Rating Program.

subparagraph.text: The term roof system means a system of roof components, including roof insulation and a membrane or primary roof covering, but not including the roof deck, designed to weather-proof and improve the thermal resistance of a building.
The term commercial building means any building which—

clause.text: is within the scope of ASHRAE Standard 90.1–2010,
is located in the United States,
with respect to which depreciation (or amortization in lieu of depreciation) is allowable, and
was placed in service prior to the roof system replacement.

subparagraph.text: The term ASHRAE means the American Society of Heating, Refrigerating and Air-Conditioning Engineers.

subsection.header: Requirement To use straight line method
subsection.text: Paragraph (3) of section 168(b) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Any qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property.

subsection.text: The table contained in section 168(g)(3)(B) of such Code is amended by striking the last item and inserting the following new items:

subsection.header: Depreciation rules for certain qualified energy-Efficient cool roof replacement property for purposes of computing the earnings and profits of a real estate investment trust

paragraph.text: Paragraph (3) of section 312(k) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Treatment of qualified energy efficient cool roof replacement property
subparagraph.text: In the case of any qualified energy-efficient cool roof replacement property (within the meaning of section 168(e)(9)), the adjustment for depreciation to earnings and profits of a real estate investment trust for any taxable year shall be determined under the alternative depreciation method (within the meaning of section 168(g)(2)), except that the recovery period shall be 20 years.

paragraph.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 312(k)(3) of such Code is amended by striking subparagraph (B), and inserting subparagraphs (B) and (C),.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.
